intro: Pietrosia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, typically pink or red flowers. These plants are adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing a variety of growth forms, including shrubs and herbs. Pietrosia species are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and Africa, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Their botanical features make them popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
